original: Engblad, Carl Torsten Sigurd Einar, fabrikör, Göteborg, f. 2/4/95 i Gbg av fabr. Carl Fredrik E. o. Helga Pettersson. G. m. Greta Fürstenberg. Barn: Sonja f. 20, g. m. disp. H. H. Rasmussen, Norrköp. — Elev v. Gbgs samsk., hand:sk., utl:stud. Res. t. Tyskl., Engl., Holl. o. USA. Anst. v. Gbgs Tapetfabr. 15-29, disp. 18-29, verkst. dir. i A-B Ljungqvists Tapetfabr. i Norrköp. fr. 26 o. i Ericsson & Köhlers Nya A-B i Sthlm 29, inneh. av Engblads Tapetfabr. i Gbg sed. 29 o. av Lotura Försäljn :centr. i Gbg sed. 37. Ordf. i styr. f. A-B Ljungqvists Tapetfabr. o. Ericsson & Köhlers Nya A-B, suppl. i styr. f. Sv. graf. ind:förb. o. Gbgs arb :förmedl., led. av Gbgs fattigv :styr. RVO 45, Jönköp. 1. hembygds för b. stGM.
translated: Engblad, Carl Torsten Sigurd Einar, industrialist, Gothenburg, born April 2, 1895 in Gothenburg to factory owner Carl Fredrik E. and Helga Pettersson. Married to Greta Fürstenberg in an unknown year. Children: Sonja (born 1920), married to H.H. Rasmussen, Norrköping. Attended Gothenburg's secondary school, studied commerce, and abroad in Germany, England, the Netherlands, and the USA. Employed at Gothenburg's Wallpaper Factory from 1915-1929, serving as manager from 1918-1929, as well as director of A-B Ljungqvist's Wallpaper Factory in Norrköping from 1926 and Ericsson & Köhlers Nya A-B in Stockholm from 1929. Owner of Engblad's Wallpaper Factory in Gothenburg from 1929 and Lotura Sales Center in Gothenburg from 1937. Chairman of the board for A-B Ljungqvist's Wallpaper Factory and Ericsson & Köhlers Nya A-B, member of the board for the Swedish Graphic Industry Association and Gothenburg Labor Mediation, and member of Gothenburg's Poor Relief board. Knight of the Order of Vasa in 1945 and recipient of the Jönköping County Heritage Association's honorary award.

education.name: Gothenburg's secondary school
